content: skyscraper windows by babs ausherman the little stacked blocks of color in this cowl remind me of windows in one of those ubiquitous skyscrapers tiny peeks into the lives or offices of many people the joy of incorporating a color changing yarn like making tracks lite is that as the cowl unfolds the views in the windows change and it s exciting to see what color is next skyscraper windows is a perfect skill-builder project with its simple repetitive pattern and short floats you don t need to keep referring to the pattern and you can focus on getting comfortable with stranded knitting over the course of the cowl for more experienced knitters this is a great knit night or tv project pick your favorite color of making tracks lite find a nice contrast in killington and cast on skyscraper windows yarn miss babs killington 85% polwarth wool 15% silk 350 yd / 4 2 oz 320 / 120g skeins 1 skein in main color shown in bloodstone and junction fiber mill making tracks lite 100% wool 210 yd/1 75 oz 192 m/50 g skeins 1 skein in contrasting color shown in sublime skies or 350 yards/320 meters main color in dk weight yarn and 210 yards/192 meters contrast color in sport or dk weight yarn finished measurements circumference 33 /82 5 cm height 8½ /21 cm needles us 6 4 0 mm circular needle 16 /40 cm or size to obtain gauge note you will need a second 16 circular needle size us 6 or smaller to hold stitches for grafting gauge blocked 24 stitches and 28 rounds = 4 /10 cm square in stranded stockinette stitch notions stitch marker tapestry needle waste yarn © babs ausherman 2024 for pattern support email info@missbabs com page 2 of 3 skyscraper windows cowl skyscraper windows chart provisional cast on with waste yarn cast on 100 key stitches join to work in the round being careful not to twist and place marker to mark beginning of round knit knit in main color two rounds alternatively you may work a provisional cast on of your choice knit in contrast color break waste yarn and join main color body of cowl with main color knit one round join contrast color and work rounds 1-4 of skyscraper windows using chart until you have used up most of your yarn ending last repeat after round 2 break contrast color and weave in ends remove provisional cast on snip a stitch in the last round of the waste yarn cast on and unpick the row of waste yarn stitches returning the first round of main color stitches to spare circular needle break main color leaving a 2 yard/2 meter tail using main color graft the ends of the cowl together finishing weave in final end and block
